Question Text: Which of the following properties are characteristics of virtual networks (but not necessarily characteristics of SDN). Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Separates the data and control plane.
b. Refactors network control so that network behavior is controlled from a single logically centralized controller.
c. Separates logical and physical networks.
d. Often deployed in data center networks to allow multiple tenants to share physical network infrastructure.
e. Abstracts the details of the physical network.
LLM Explanation: Virtual networks have the following key characteristics:  c) They separate the logical network topology from the underlying physical network infrastructure. Multiple virtual networks can be created on top of the same physical network.  d) They are commonly used in data center environments to allow multiple tenants or customers to share the same physical network infrastructure while maintaining isolation between their networks.  e) Virtual networks abstract away the details and complexity of the physical network from the perspective of the virtual network user or tenant. While virtual networks and SDN are related concepts that often go together, properties (a) separating data and control planes, and (b) logically centralized control, are more specific to SDN rather than being inherent to virtual networks in general.
URLs: ['https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_network', 'https://www.vmware.com/topics/glossary/content/virtual-networking', "Nadeau, Thomas D., and Ken Gray. SDN: Software Defined Networks: an authoritative review of network programmability technologies. O'Reilly Media, Inc., 2013."]

Question Text: Which of the following are possible ways of creating virtual links in a virtual network? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an IP packet is encapsulated in an MPLS tunnel by attaching an MPLS header to the packet.
b. Longest-prefix match forwarding on an IP router.
c. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an Ethernet packet sent between two virtual machines is encapsulated in an IP packet.
d. VLAN switching based on a VLAN tag.
e. Pairs of virtual Ethernet interfaces, where one end of the Ethernet interface pair resides in the virtual environment, and the other resides in the root namespace on the host machine.
LLM Explanation: Virtual links in a virtual network can be created in several ways:a) Using MPLS tunnels to encapsulate IP packets, which allows virtual links across a wide area.  c) Encapsulating Ethernet packets sent between VMs inside IP packets, enabling wide-area tunneling.d) VLAN switching based on tags to create isolated virtual links on a shared physical network.e) Pairing virtual Ethernet interfaces between the virtual environment and host namespace.Longest-prefix match forwarding (b) is a regular IP routing technique, not specifically for creating virtual links.

Question Text: Which of the following are true of the Mininet network emulator? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. It requires running OpenFlow-capable switches.
b. It is difficult to use it to route traffic for real services.
c. Mininet only allows users to create three types of topologies: linear, tree, and single-switch topologies.
d. It can create an emulation that runs across multiple physically distributed nodes.
e. All of the hosts in the topology must run the same underlying operating system.
LLM Explanation: Mininet does not require running OpenFlow-capable switches, as it can emulate OpenFlow switches in software (a is incorrect). Mininet can be used to route traffic for real services, but it is not well-suited for this purpose due to performance limitations of the emulation environment (b is correct). Mininet allows users to create arbitrary network topologies, not just linear, tree, and single-switch (c is incorrect). Mininet can distribute the emulation across multiple physical machines to improve scalability (d is correct). The emulated hosts in Mininet share the same kernel, but can run different software (e is incorrect).
SM - Description: Not knowing that d is incorrect. Misunderstanding choices as choice ‘e’ is saying same operating system, not same software

Question Text: What are the benefits of emulation as opposed to, say, simulation? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. An emulation will complete faster than a simulation.
b. An emulator makes it possible to "port" experiments from one machine to another.
c. An emulator allows the experimenter run real software on each of the nodes in the emulation.
d. An emulation is easier to debug than a simulation.
e. Every run of the emulator will yield exactly the same results, resulting in reproducible experiments.
LLM Explanation: Emulation has a couple key benefits over simulation. First, an emulator makes it possible to 'port' experiments from one machine to another (b), allowing for reproducibility and sharing of experimental setups. Second, and perhaps most importantly, an emulator allows the experimenter to run real software on each of the nodes in the emulation (c). This means the behavior will match what would happen on real hardware more closely than a simulation. The other options are not necessarily benefits of emulation - a simulation may run faster (a), be easier to debug (d), and be more deterministic (e) than an emulation.

Question Text: Which of the following are possible in Mininet? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Measuring the latency between a host in San Francisco and a host in Los Angeles.
b. Assigning custom IP addresses to each node in the topology.
c. Assigning IP addresses to each node in the topology using a DHCP server.
d. Running performance measurement tools (e.g., iperf, wget) between nodes.
e. "Shaping" a link between two nodes to a particular traffic rate.
LLM Explanation: In Mininet, it is possible to assign custom IP addresses to each node in the topology (b), run performance measurement tools like iperf and wget between nodes (d), and shape the traffic rate on a link between two nodes (e). However, Mininet runs as a single process on a single machine, so it cannot measure latency between geographically distant hosts (a). Also, while IP addresses can be assigned, Mininet does not include a DHCP server functionality to automatically assign them (c).
URLs: ['Mininet Walkthrough - https://github.com/mininet/mininet/wiki/Walkthrough', 'Introduction to Mininet - https://github.com/mininet/mininet/wiki/Introduction-to-Mininet', 'Mininet Python API Reference Manual - http://mininet.org/api/annotated.html']
SM - Description: Missing info - mining does offer a DHCP server

Question Text: Which of the following functions does FlowVisor enable? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different load balancing applications for all traffic between the same source-destination pair.
b. Allowing two controllers to control traffic on distinct VLANs.
c. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different Web load balancing applications for port 80 traffic.
d. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy control mechanisms for two distinct applications.
e. Allowing one controller to control TCP traffic and one controller to control UDP traffic.
LLM Explanation: FlowVisor enables network virtualization by allowing multiple controllers to simultaneously control different parts of the network. It can slice the network based on various criteria like VLAN tags (b), distinct applications or experiments (d), and traffic types like TCP vs UDP (e). However, it cannot allow different controllers to control the exact same traffic between a source-destination pair (a) or on the same port (c), as that would lead to conflicts.

Question Text: Which of the following are stated applications of the Nicira Network Virtualization Platform? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Easier transition to IPv6 in data-center networks.
b. Creating more than 1024 virtual networks, as opposed to the alternative of using VLAN tags.
c. Allowing experimental protocols to coincide with a production network.
d. Central management of security policies.
e. Dynamic workload placement in multi-tenant data centers.
LLM Explanation: The Nicira Network Virtualization Platform enables several applications, including: creating more than 1024 virtual networks, which exceeds the limit of VLANs (b); allowing experimental protocols to run alongside production traffic in the same physical network (c); centrally managing security policies across the virtual networks (d); and enabling dynamic placement of workloads in multi-tenant data center environments (e). The platform does not specifically aim to ease IPv6 transition in data centers (a).
URLs: ['Nicira Network Virtualization Platform (NVP) Whitepaper, Nicira Networks, 2012', 'The Road to SDN: An Intellectual History of Programmable Networks, N. Feamster et al., ACM Queue, 2013']
SM - Description: Missing information since NIcira cannot handle experimental protocols in a production networks

Question Text: Select the statement that is most true about the relationship between network virtualization and SDNs.
Choices:
a. Network virtualization is a potential enabler for software-defined networks, since the separation of data and control planes first requires the creation of a logical network.
b. Software-defined networking is a potential enabler for virtual networks, since separation of data and control planes makes it easier to manage a logical network topology.
c. Network virtualization is a new concept introduced by Amazon, Nicira, and industry players; it only made sense to talk about network virtualization once central SDN controllers existed.
d. Network virtualization and software-defined networking each enable the other: SDN cannot exist without network virtualization, and network virtualization cannot exist without SDN.
LLM Explanation: Both statements a and b are true about the relationship between network virtualization and SDNs. Network virtualization enables the creation of logical networks separate from the underlying physical infrastructure, which is a prerequisite for separating the data and control planes in SDNs. At the same time, the separation of data and control planes in SDNs makes it easier to manage and orchestrate virtual network topologies. So network virtualization and SDN are complementary technologies that enable each other, but one is not strictly dependent on the other.
SM - Description: (a) is simply false. SDN does not require network virtualization
SM - Misunderstanding General (secondary: Otherwise didn't understand the goal of the question
SM - Misunderstanding Reasons (secondary: Interpreted a word or background incorrectly
